questions.question: Could you pass me ……………………? I have spilled some juice on the floor.
questions.description: A cloth is a piece of material used for cleaning.

questions.question: I must buy ……………………………
questions.description: Clothes does not have a singular form. We say a piece of clothing.

questions.question: The poor man was arrested for stealing ………………………….
questions.description: Bread is uncountable in English. The countable equivalents are a piece of bread / a loaf.

questions.question: How ………………………. money do you earn in a week?
questions.description: Money is uncountable in English and hence it is used with much.

questions.question: A ………………………….. struck the building.
questions.description: Lightning is uncountable. The countable equivalent is a flash of lightning.

questions.question: I was held up by ………………………..
questions.description: Traffic is uncountable. It does not have a plural form.

questions.question: Politics ………………………. a dirty game.
questions.description: Politics is usually considered as a singular noun.

questions.question: In my opinion, too much mathematics ………………………. taught in schools.
questions.description: Mathematics is usually considered as a singular noun.

questions.question: We are all eager to increase our ……………………………
questions.description: Knowledge does not have a plural form.

questions.question: Six people lost their ……………………… in the accident.
questions.description: To talk about several people doing the same thing or the same thing being done to several people, we normally use the plural form of the noun.
